Key Match Events: Jimmy Butler scored exactly nine points and played exactly zero seconds in the fourth quarter for the second consecutive game.
He has not reached double figures in scoring in three consecutive games, the first time that’s happened since November 2013.
Pre-Game Insights: Jimmy Butler said he needs to find joy again on the basketball court.
He wants to get his joy back and be back to somewhere dominant.
He wants to hoop and help the team win.
Post-Match Reflections: Jimmy Butler said he felt like he was focused and did his job.
He added that he hasn’t been that since his first, second, third year in the league.
He will continue competing and won’t say that he’s out there not playing hard.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Butler was the best player on two Heat teams that went to the NBA Finals.
He was eligible for a two-year, $113 million extension starting last summer and Miami has yet to offer a new deal to the 35-year-old.
Others: ESPN reported after Butler’s postgame comments on Thursday that he has ‘indicated’ to the Heat that he wants a trade.
The Heat have no practice Friday and host Utah on Saturday.
